name: libpcap
description: libpcap is a portable library in C/C++ for packet capture.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependent_to.name: hping
dependent_to.description: hping is a command-line oriented TCP/IP packet assembler/analyzer.

dependent_to.name: tcpdump
dependent_to.description:
Tcpdump prints out a description of the contents of packets on a network
interface that match the Boolean expression; the description is preceded
by a time stamp, printed, by default, as hours, minutes, seconds, and
fractions of a second since midnight.

dependent_to.name: dnstop
dependent_to.description: Stay on top of your DNS traffic.

dependent_to.name: wireshark
dependent_to.description: Graphical network analyzer and capture tool

dependent_to.name: tcptrace
dependent_to.description:
tcptrace is a tool written by Shawn Ostermann at Ohio University for
analysis of TCP dump files. It can take as input the files produced by
several popular packet-capture programs, including tcpdump, snoop,
etherpeek, HP Net Metrix, and WinDump.

dependent_to.name: libnids
dependent_to.description:
Libnids is a library that provides a functionality of one of NIDS
(Network Intrusion Detection System) components, namely E-component.

dependent_to.name: dropwatch
dependent_to.description:
Dropwatch is a project I started in an effort to improve the ability for
developers and system administrator to diagnose problems in the Linux
Networking stack, specifically in our ability to diagnose where packets
are getting dropped.

dependent_to.name: addrwatch
dependent_to.description:
A tool similar to arpwatch for IPv4/IPv6 and ethernet address pairing
monitoring.

dependent_to.name: procenv
dependent_to.description:
A command-line tool that displays as much detail about itself and its
environment as possible. It can be used as a test tool, to understand
the type of environment a process runs in, and for comparing system
environments.
